title: Automation.com - All Industrial Automation News and Products

items.title: Take Proactive Steps to Ensure Supply Chain Cybersecurity
items.author: Daniele Mancini
items.summary:
- The World Economic Forum shows supply chain challenges are the main obstacle to cyber resilience for *54%* of large firms, with *98%* reporting breaches, driving ecosystem-wide risk orchestration.
- Six drivers—*geopolitical tensions*, *AI/tech risks*, *regulatory proliferation*, *supply interdependencies*, *cybercrime*, and the *skills gap*—demand proactive governance and AI-powered monitoring.
- Models include **Centralized**, **Blended**, and **Standards-oriented** integration; plus *zero-trust*, continuous data collection, and post-quantum readiness planning.

items.title: The Wisdom of Correct Pressure Measurements
items.author: Abhishek Sharma
items.summary:
- The article explains how *static pressure* vs *dynamic pressure* readings can be wrong when tapping or transmitter placement is incorrect, with examples like downstream/upstream discrepancies.
- It covers altitude effects, momentum, elbows, and other design pitfalls that cause unexpected measurements in towers, vessels, and pipelines.
- It offers practical guidelines to avoid errors: *wet/dry leg calibration*, 10D spacing, remote seals, and regular flushing of transmitter tubing.

items.title: Siemens & TRUMPF accelerate digital manufacturing & AI
items.summary:
- *Siemens* and **TRUMPF** announce a partnership to bridge IT and OT by integrating Siemens' Xcelerator with TRUMPF's machine-building and software expertise, accelerating digital manufacturing and AI readiness.
- The collaboration will deliver open, interoperable interfaces and modular architectures so shop-floor data and enterprise systems connect seamlessly, boosting innovation cycles and scalability.
- Customers can expect faster time-to-market, improved production flexibility, and AI-enabled operations through standardized, future-proof automation solutions.

items.title: Ethernet and AI at ECOC 2025 Demo
items.summary:
- The *Ethernet Alliance* will demo the *Future of Ethernet* at ECOC 2025 with a live multivendor display of *100G–800G* links and *LPO* for AI training and deployment. 
- The demo highlights *high bandwidth*, *low latency*, and interoperable provisioning to speed up AI clusters and real‑time inference. 
- Partners like Alphawave Semi, Cisco, Huawei, and others show plug‑and‑play IP such as the *AlphaCHIP1600* to enable seamless Ethernet across data centers and edge AI accelerators.

items.title: Smart PSV Monitoring for Process Safety
items.author: Mashhood Zafar
items.summary:
- PSVs require *continuous online monitoring* because drift, chatter and abnormal blowdown are often missed by manual in-service testing. 
- A real-time setup using upstream/downstream pressures (P1, P2) and ΔP trends in a PLC/SCADA/DCS yields a **real‑world fingerprint** of PSV performance and helps detect chatter. 
- Design challenges include *sensor survivability*, high-speed sensing and IEC 61511 compliance, with diagnostics that *support* rather than replace SIS.

items.title: Digital Twin Consortium Adds Eight New Testbeds
items.summary:
*The *Digital Twin Consortium* added eight new testbeds to its program, bringing total testbeds to sixteen and expanding global collaboration in digital twins.*
**TWINSENSE** enables real-time virtual sensing; **SAFESME** targets rapid SME onboarding; **Q-Smart** delivers a secure, self-learning home network with quantum-safe protocols.
*The program uses the **Composability Framework** and invites members to advance AI, multi-agent systems, and digital twin tech across industries.*

items.title: FLUX Whitepaper: Inductive Rotary Encoders
items.author: FLUX GmbH
items.summary:
- FLUX GmbH has published a whitepaper on *Inductive Rotary Encoders* to enable next‑generation performance across robotics, medical, aerospace, and defense applications.
- The paper outlines six reasons to choose *FLUX inductive encoders* and notes scenarios where other technologies may be better suited, highlighting both advantages and limits.
- FLUX’s solution features robustness, a low axial profile, high resolution and immunity to magnetic interference, with the *IND-MAX* family enabling compact, scalable designs.

items.title: COMAU AI at ETFA 2025
items.summary:
- Comau presented **AI-driven** strategies for the manufacturing sector at *ETFA 2025*, highlighting intelligent tools and neural-network optimization.
- Giovanni Di Stefano stressed Comau's ability to tailor **AI models** to diverse industries using decades of data and PLM archives.
- Projects like MI.RA vision systems and AI-enabled welding verification demonstrate improved productivity and quality from customized *AI solutions*.

items.title: Wibu-Systems Enables PlantStream's Global Growth
items.summary:
- Wibu-Systems' *CodeMeter* protects PlantStream’s IP, simplifies license management, and enables seamless global access for engineering teams.
- A hybrid licensing model uses *CmCloud* via *CodeMeter License Central* and *WebDepot* for instant activation, with *CmActLicense* for offline use and *License Reporting* for daily insights.
- PlantStream’s 3D CAD platform can route ~1,000 pipes/min and speeds feasibility/FE design by up to *75%*, supporting a secure, cloud-friendly global rollout.

items.title: CMC Networks names Mahesh Jaishankar MD
items.summary:
- **Mahesh Jaishankar** named Managing Director of CMC Networks to lead growth in *AI-powered connectivity* across Africa and the Middle East.
- He brings over 25 years of leadership experience, including roles at *Google* and *Arthur D. Little*, and helped launch **datamena** as a global digital hub.
- Under his leadership, CMC Networks aims to accelerate **AIOps** adoption and strengthen its position post-2024 acquisition by **center3**.

items.title: Electromate SPARK Symposiums: Waterloo & Montreal
items.summary:
- The biennial Fall SPARK Symposiums will be held on Oct 28, 2025 in **Waterloo** (University of Waterloo) and Oct 30, 2025 in **Montreal** (ÉTS), with tabletop shows and classroom sessions on **robotics** and **mechatronics**. 
- The events are complimentary and targeted at **OEMs**, machine builders, system integrators, and engineering students, with free registration and meals provided. 
- Attendees can engage with leading manufacturers, network, and explore high‑performance automation solutions in a showroom‑like format.

items.title: 75% Endorse 'Secure by Operations' for OT security
items.summary:
- The Forrester study found 91% of global OT organizations suffered a breach or failure in the past 18 months, causing interruptions, revenue loss, and reputational damage.
- 75% say **Secure by Operations** strategies are instrumental in mitigating future OT attacks.
- Organizations adopting these principles report up to 53% faster recovery and 51% lower CapEx, with gains in reputation, efficiency, and compliance.

items.title: Copia & Danieli Drive Industrial DevOps Globally
items.summary:
- Copia Automation and *Danieli Automation DIGI&MET* announce a strategic partnership to deploy Copia's **Industrial DevOps** platform across Italy and the US.
- The collaboration will streamline automation workflows, boost cross‑team collaboration, and accelerate software development, with Danieli using Copia's EU Cloud and aligning to *NIS2* compliance.
- Executives highlight a shared commitment to *innovation* and operational excellence as it accelerates digital transformation in metals manufacturing.

items.title: ANSI/R15.06 Robot Safety Standard Now Available
items.summary: - *ANSI/A3 R15.06-2025* is published and available through *A3*, marking a major advance in *industrial robot safety*.\n- It covers *Part 1* and *Part 2* safety, aligns with US adoption of *ISO 10218*, and adds guidance on *collaborative robots*, *end-effectors*, and *cybersecurity*.\n- It is available as a protected PDF via the *A3 online store*; pricing starts at *$655*, with *Part 3* to follow later at no extra cost.

items.title: Hitachi Expands U.S. Advanced Manufacturing & Electrification
items.summary:
- Hitachi announces US investments across *advanced manufacturing*, *power grid infrastructure*, and *digital solutions* to spur innovation and local job growth.
- Key milestones include a *$100M digital railcar factory* in Maryland, a *$1B energy grid expansion*, and a new Automation HQ in Zeeland, MI.
- The program aims to bolster the U.S. economy with thousands of jobs, resilience, and long-term collaboration between public and private sectors.

items.title: Unified Device Integration Roadmap Solidified
items.summary:
- The SIC released a timeline for the **updated FDI Specification** to *unify device integration* across process, hybrid, and factory automation.
- Enhancements include **CRA compliance**, a common information model (**PA-DIM**), legacy-system support, real-time OT/IT connectivity, and nested communications.
- Leadership from **OPC Foundation**, **ODVA**, PI, and FieldComm Group endorse the harmonization of **FDI** and **FDT** to provide a practical migration path and broader interoperability.

items.title: Embracing Network Segmentation for Warehouse Cybersecurity
items.author: Zac Amos
items.summary:
- *Network segmentation* divides IT/OT into zones to limit attacker movement and protect critical assets.
- Microsegmentation and policy controls improve defense but aren’t a silver bullet; ongoing monitoring is essential.
- Three steps: map data flow; define segmentation strategy; implement and monitor controls.

items.title: Siemens Tech Drives Bluegame's New Yacht
items.summary:
- Siemens partners with Bluegame as an *Innovative Technology Partner* on the BGF45 foiling yacht, premiering at the Cannes Yachting Festival.
- The *SENTRON ECPD* enables intelligent energy management and ultra-fast fault response, reducing maintenance costs and supporting customization for different electrical loads.
- The project earned the **EcoTech** label, enabling up to 80% savings on electronics, up to 90% on metals and plastics, and about 85% space reduction in the electrical distribution board, aligning with Bluegame's sustainability goals.

items.title: SVS-Vistek SWIR Cameras for Subsurface Defects
items.summary:
- SWIR cameras enable visualization of subsurface defects in wafers that are invisible to visible light, such as *micro-cracks*, *impurities*, and particles. 
- SVS-Vistek's SenSWIR FXO cameras offer extended 400–1700 nm coverage and high frame rates (up to 132 fps at 5.2 MP) with GenICam 3.0, enabling fast, integrated inspection. 
- Active cooling like *Thermoelectric Cooling (TEC)* reduces thermal noise to improve image quality, aiding higher yield and reliability in semiconductor manufacturing.

items.title: Alva Industries’ Tech Torqs: New Video Series Explains Motor Physics and Design
FIA Selects Siemens as Official Digital Twin Sponsor
Boosting Free Pallets Automation for Speed and Scalability
items.summary: - *Free pallets automation* enables scalable, high-speed manufacturing with decoupled stations and built-in *traceability*.\n- *Modular cells* with *Yamaha robotics* and the *LCMR200* transfer system boost throughput and enable rapid scale-up for large contracts.\n- *Per-unit data* with tight tolerances (±30 µm) enhances quality control and regulatory compliance while supporting mixed-model production.

items.title: Mouser Electronics Explores 3D Printing Revolution and Its Impact on Design, Engineering and Manufacturing
items.summary:
- *Additive manufacturing* is accelerating design, engineering and manufacturing through *AI*, new materials and faster production cycles.
- It enables applications like *FAA-approved* engine components made from 3D printable *titanium* and human cartilage implants made from biomaterials, expanding design freedom.
- Mouser's Empowering Innovation Together program and the accompanying content explore workflows, materials, *AI* tools and on-demand, *localized production*.

items.title: Matthews expands Freespace Robotics investment
items.summary: - Matthews Automation Solutions expands its investment in *Freespace Robotics* and purchases a flagship *Freespace ASRS* for deployment at its new *Atlanta center*, following a strong showing at *ProMat 2025*.\n- Freespace’s high-density *ASRS cube* integrates with Matthews’ **NEXUS WES** to orchestrate inbound and outbound workflows, delivering real-time insights and scalable throughput.\n- The partnership will be showcased at **MODEX 2026**, highlighting modular, interoperable, rapid-deployment solutions for a broad range of warehouse needs.

items.title: Mitsubishi Electric to Acquire Nozomi Networks to Improve Industrial Cyber Defenses
Bentley Systems, Enactus Announce Winner of the 2025 iTwin4Good Challenge
Siemens Sets New Pace for EPD Transparency
items.summary:
- Siemens' automated EPD solution has been officially approved by **EPD-Global**, enabling **independently verified EPDs** and substantially speeding up the **verification process**. 
- Executives say the partnership demonstrates how *digitalization* scales *environmental transparency* and strengthens Siemens' **leadership in sustainability**. 
- Siemens currently offers ISO-compliant self-declared EPDs for over 50% of its products and aims for **100% verified EPD coverage by 2030**.

items.title: NEMA and Allied Associations Release Tariff Incentive Proposal
items.summary:
- The *tariff incentive proposal* from NEMA and allies aims to accelerate onshoring of electrical equipment and data-center infrastructure via time-limited tariff offsets. 
- It outlines a three-pronged framework: *Capital Investment*, *Grid Infrastructure*, and *Domestic Manufacturing* incentives to boost U.S. manufacturing and energy priorities. 
- Industry voices from NECA, NAED, Data Center Coalition, and NEMRA back the plan as essential to jobs, grid reliability, and AI capability.

items.title: How Manufacturers Can Turn Real-Time Data Into Productivity Gains
items.author: Alex Douglas
items.summary:
- *Edge computing* processes time-sensitive data near the source, reducing *latency* and bandwidth while enabling immediate action.
- A **smart data strategy** moves from indiscriminate collection to *targeted, time-aware* data, unlocking *predictive maintenance*, tighter *inventory* control, and stronger governance to cut costs and risk.
- With *localized processing* and lean data filtering, manufacturers gain a current, unified view of operations and drive sustained **productivity** gains.

items.title: A Lasting Collaboration: Rollon Supports Skyward and the Orion Rocket at EuRoC 2025
Nefab Opens Southeast Hub in Braselton, GA
items.summary:
- Nefab opened a new Southeast Hub in Braselton, GA, relocating from Norcross with a **$9.5 million** investment.
- The facility **triples** the footprint to 150,000 square feet and expands production for the *cloud*, *automotive*, and *healthcare* markets.
- It will create **30 new jobs** and strengthen local supply chains across the Southeast.

items.title: TDK Announces Tronics Is Entering Machine and Asset Health Monitoring Market With Vibration Sensor Solutions
Machinery Orders Dip Against Stronger Year-Over-Year Gains
Predictive Precision: How Vibration Monitoring and Targeted Maintenance Extend Machinery Life
NEMA Welcomes Four Members, Elevating Industry Leadership
items.summary:
- NEMA welcomed three manufacturing members (Hyosung HICO, Milwaukee Tool, SWARCO McCain) and one associate member (IPS) to expand its 300+ member ecosystem, advancing *electrification* leadership.
- The new members will help accelerate grid reliability, safer buildings, and smarter mobility across industrial automation through extended collaboration.
- Leaders stress stronger **standards**, **innovation**, and a more resilient energy future powered by electricity.

items.title: Wauseon & Kawasaki at FABTECH 2025
items.summary:
- Wauseon Machine teams with **Kawasaki Robotics** to showcase *tube forming technology* at FABTECH 2025 in Chicago (Sept 8–11), booth B15001.
- The collaboration highlights seamless automation for high‑mix, variable‑volume runs within a collaborative *automation environment*, combining WM’s tube forming expertise with Kawasaki's robotics.
- Attendees can see live demos, connect with experts, and learn how *automation + tube forming* can drive business growth.

items.title: SEMI: Global semiconductor billings up 24% YoY in Q2-2025
items.summary:
- The WWSEMS report shows global semiconductor equipment billings rose *24% YoY* to **US$33.07B** in Q2 2025.
- Q2 2025 billings grew **3% QoQ**, helped by leading-edge logic, HBM-related DRAM, and stronger Asia shipments.
- SEMI notes strong H1 2025 with over **$65B** revenue and **$117B** in 2024, driven by AI investment and capacity expansion.

items.title: Drive Selection & Ordering with myNORD Online Tools
items.summary: - The *myNORD online portal* is a 24/7 e-commerce platform used by 26,500+ users, with flexible collaboration and a search that includes *input power*, *speed*, and *torque*.\n- It features a **Product Configurator** and plausibility checks, with saved quotes and account-specific pricing for easy submission.\n- A **Spare Parts Shop** and **Unit Identification** tool enable fast part finds, BOMs, pricing, and shipping options, with ERP integration on the horizon.

items.title: What to Expect at the 2025 ISA Automation Summit & Expo
items.author: Kara Phelps
items.summary: - The 2025 ISA Automation Summit & Expo runs Oct 5–7 at Disney’s Coronado Springs; the Expo features 74 vendors, *IT/OT convergence*, safety tech and the Student Simulation Showdown.\n- Keynotes blend strategy and technology, with talks like *To Infinity and Beyond* and *Confessions of a Dirty Hacker*, plus a fully sortable conference agenda.\n- *ICS4ICS* hands-on workshop offers practical defense; plan outcomes, schedule networking, and capture notes to maximize value; registration starts around **$835** for ISA members.

items.title: The Real ROI of Augmented Reality in Manufacturing: Beyond the Hype
items.author: Hélène Motycka
items.summary:
- AR delivers tangible ROI through *efficiency* gains (e.g., up to 60% productivity uplift) and faster onboarding, cutting training time by up to *50%*. 
- AR reduces *errors* and costs (lower defect rates, up to 30% inspection-time reductions, up to 80% rework cut) and improves safety and traceability. 
- A structured ROI approach (define objectives, select metrics, pick the right tech, calculate costs, measure outcomes, monitor and optimize) makes AR a strategic, long-term investment.

items.title: IFCO Opens Texas Facility for Fresh Grocery Innovation
items.summary:
- IFCO opened the *Dallas Service Center* in *Mesquite*, strengthening its North American *reusable packaging* network to serve growers and retailers.
- The 240,000-square-foot facility features *latest-generation wash and automation technology*, 15 loading docks, and will employ 100+ people to ensure safer, more sustainable operations.
- It will service 40+ million crates annually, enable 450+ million family interactions, and drive over 1 billion consumer touchpoints through the **SmartCycle** program.

items.title: IoT Waste Crisis: Wireless Power Escape
items.author: Charles Greene
items.summary:
- *IoT* growth to about 40B devices by 2030 is driving a massive *battery waste* and maintenance challenge.
- Millions of disposable batteries are discarded daily, harming *ecosystems* and increasing costs and logistics burdens.
- *RF-based wireless power* enables *battery-free* IoT deployments today, reducing waste and maintenance while boosting efficiency.

items.title: Siemens and Snowflake: IT/OT Convergence Across Edge & Cloud
items.summary:
- *Siemens Industrial Edge* and *Snowflake AI Data Cloud* connect OT and IT data, enabling AI‑driven insights and a unified data foundation.
- Plug‑and‑play Industrial Edge apps contextualize OT data and transfer it into IT, boosting machine performance and production.
- FFT, a Snowflake and Siemens partner, acts as an integrator to securely move data to the cloud and extend the solution across facilities.

items.title: The Replace, Repair or Retrain Decision
items.author: Brandon Glenn
items.summary:
- The article presents a **four-step framework** to decide when to replace, repair, or retrain, covering assessment, cost comparison, new-machine advantages, and realizing returns.
- Step 1 — Assess machinery and operator skill levels; evaluate repair frequency, production demands, and the role of ongoing *education and training* to boost performance.
- Step 4 — Realize new machine benefits, including lifecycle costs, financing options, and productivity gains from newer controls and automation.

items.title: In Memoriam: Hans D. Baumann, Ph.D, P.E.
items.author: Renee Bassett
items.summary:
- Dr. Hans D. Baumann, PE, died at 94 on March 25, 2025, in West Palm Beach, leaving a 70-year legacy in *valve design* and process control.
- He designed or directed over 30 valve lines (including CAMFLEX) and held more than 150 patents with 200+ papers, shaping standards and earning many awards.
- His work bridged academia and industry, pioneering fundamentals in *valve sizing*, *noise prediction*, and authoring references like *Fluid Mechanics of Control Valves* and *Control Valve Primer*.

items.title: Topical Roundup: August/September 2025
Using Foundation Fieldbus Linking Devices in Industry 4.0
items.author: Graham Proctor
items.summary:
- Foundation Fieldbus linking devices act as intelligent gateways, bridging legacy *Foundation Fieldbus* networks with PLC/DCS/SCADA for *Industry 4.0* architectures.
- They enable *seamless data exchange* between Fieldbus H1 and industrial Ethernet, provide *in-depth diagnostics*, and support *continuous health monitoring* to reduce downtime.
- With *redundancy*, secure and scalable **connectivity**, and *cloud/edge integration*, linking devices enhance reliability and enable advanced analytics.

items.title: Process Control Charts Ensure Manufacturing Excellence
items.author: Nikhil Makhija
items.summary: - *Control charts* are a core tool in *statistical process control (SPC)* used to maintain process stability and improve quality across industries.\n- They help distinguish common-cause variation from special causes, guiding **preventive actions** and supporting **Six Sigma** initiatives.\n- Implementing control charts requires data collection, parameter estimation, plotting over time, and interpreting patterns to reduce defects and waste.

items.title: The Future of Process Automation in Bioprocessing
Reducing Complexity in Data Center Cooling
items.author: Endress + Hauser Communications
items.summary:
- Hyperscale data centers are transitioning from *air cooling* to *liquid cooling* to meet dense HPC/AI workloads, with *liquid cooling* offering superior heat transfer and reducing hotspots.
- Traditional *invasive sensors* in thermowells introduce leakage risk, higher maintenance, wake-frequency design complexity, and energy penalties from flow disturbances.
- Endress+Hauser's *iTHERM SurfaceLine TM611* non-invasive sensor clamps to the pipe, reducing contamination risk, improving accuracy, and lowering energy consumption by minimizing flow disruption.
